description: Founded in 1988 and headquartered in Hershey, Pennsylvania, USA with offices in New York, New York, USA, and in Beijing, China (IGI Science and Technology, Ltd.), IGI Global Scientific Publishing is a rapidly growing, mid-sized, independent international academic publisher dedicated to releasing high-quality, peer-reviewed scholarly research publications in the three major academic subject areas of Business & Management, Science, Technology, & Medicine (STM), and Education & Social Science. Our commitment is to advance the discovery of pioneering scientific research promptly through swift and agile processes, with books released in approximately 6-9 months from start to finish. With more than 200,000 research collaborations with experts from leading institutions around the world, we will publish over 1,000+ books during 2025 copyright year, positioning our publishing output among the industry’s giants with centuries of history. Our Open Access Journal Program includes nearly 200 fully open access journals, making IGI Global Scientific Publishing one of the largest 100% open access journal publishers in the world. Through traditional book publishing and open access options, we strive to bring cutting-edge high-quality research at the pace of innovation, ensuring that tomorrow’s research is published today.
name: IGI Global Scientific Publishing
tagline: A Leading Independent Academic Publisher of International Scientific Research

similar_companies.name: IGI - International General Insurance Co. Ltd.

updates.text:
Discover this featured #OA paper, “A Meta-Analytic Structural Equation Modelling (MASEM) Approach Toward Scrutinizing the Influence of Brand Equity Antecedents on Brand Advocacy”, by Abdullah Nabeel AlRoshoud (Qatar University, Qatar) and Hatem Osman El-Gohary (Qatar University, Qatar), published in the International Journal of Customer Relationship Marketing and Management (IJCRMM). Brand equity antecedents are essential in the creation and development of brand advocacy strategies and implementation tactics that transform conventional customers into active brand advocates. Yet, the association incorporating these two concepts is less studied. Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/4eqbOF0

#QatarUniversity #BrandAdvocacy #BrandAwareness #BrandImage

Meet the four winners of the IGI Global Scientific Publishing 2024 Charleston Conference Librarian Scholarship Award! Each winner applied to the scholarship by answering an #AI Question about #Libraries and then met with our own in-house librarian, Jim Kapoun, at the conference. This opportunity allowed for a meeting of the minds, where they could tackle problems their libraries are experiencing. To see their responses to the questions and learn more about the winners, check out the IGI Global Scientific Publishing Newsroom: https://buff.ly/3UYDARY 

The conference may be over, but you can still take advantage of the code 2024CC15 for 15% off our already discounted books (10% sale ends December 31, 2024) until December 10, 2024. Valid only on buff.ly/48U4VKO.
Check out the latest Open Access Research Articles https://buff.ly/3UTV7e8  #OA #AccessibleResearch #FreeResearch #BusinessResearch #STEMResearch #EducationResearch #SocialScienceResearch

Check out this #OA paper, “A Novel Spatial Data Pipeline for Streaming Smart City Data”, by Chase D. Carthen (University of Nevada, Reno, USA), Araam Zaremehrjardi (University of Nevada, Reno, USA), et al., featured in the International Journal of Software Innovation (IJSI). Point cloud data from light detection and ranging (LiDAR) is often used for its spatial qualities, particularly in smart city projects involving vehicles and pedestrians. In this paper, the authors introduce a streaming and an on-demand pipeline for capturing LiDAR data from Velodyne Ultra Pucks placed along nine northern Nevada intersections known as the Living Lab within smart city project for the City of Reno. Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/3O26AVj

#UniversityofNevadaReno #BigData #DataPipeline #EdgeComputing

Discover this featured #OA paper, “Towards the Path of Process Digitalization: A Systematic Literature Review”, by Isaias Bianchi (Federal University of Santa Catarina, Brazil), António Galguinho (Instituto Universitário de Lisboa, Portugal), et al., published in the International Journal of Service Science, Management, Engineering, and Technology (IJSSMET). Organizations continue to have difficulty achieving the full potential of digital transformation (DT). DT can be conceived as a process of change in the business model, driven by digital innovation and the intensive use of ICTs to add value to the customer, processes and the business itself in way to change, threaten or complement the market. Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/4ftCx4g

#BusinessProcessManagement #DigitalTechnologies #DigitalTransformation

IGI Global Scientific Publishing stands with United2Act in combating paper mills to protect the quality and integrity of academic research. Founded by scholars, we are deeply committed to upholding ethical standards and supporting the global academic community. Learn more about how we’re taking action to ensure research integrity and foster a trustworthy scholarly landscape.  https://buff.ly/48MmUCY 
#ResearchIntegrity #AcademicCommunity #United2Act

Check out this #OA paper, “MLOps: From a Cottage Industry to a Factory Approach”, by Hugh J. Watson (University of Georgia, USA) and Deanna Larson (Lawson & Associates, USA), featured in the International Journal of Business Intelligence Research (IJBIR). Companies are moving from a cottage industry to a factory approach to analytics, especially in regard to machine learning (ML) models. This change is motivating companies to adopt ML operations (MLOps) as a methodology for the timely development, deployment, and maintenance of ML models in order to positively impact business outcomes. Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/3UzLIbB

#UGA #DataOps #DevOps #InformationSystems #MachineLearning

Explore the latest #OA paper, “Text Analysis on Green Supply Chain Practices of Electronic Companies”, by Shilpa Balan (California State University, Los Angeles, USA), Sumali Conlon (University of Mississippi, USA), et al., published in the International Journal of Decision Support System Technology (IJDSST). The electronics industry is one of the major regulated industries in the United States that is profoundly impacted by environmental issues. In this study, we use natural language processing (NLP) techniques to analyze reports from major electronics companies to examine the impact on their environmental performance in alignment with the standards set by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/4fyoAlJ

#CalStateLA #UniversityofMississippi #DataMining #ElectronicsIndustry #GreenSupplyChain

Discover this featured #OA paper, “Drug Recognition Detection Based on Deep Learning and Improved YOLOv8”, by Andrew W. H. Ip (University of Saskatchewan, Canada), Dingju Zhu (South China Normal University, China), et al., published in the Journal of Organizational and End User Computing (JOEUC). Identifying drugs from surveillance or other videos presents challenges such as small target sizes, class imbalance, and similarities to other objects. Additionally, the hardware used to capture videos and the video resolution and clarity limit model scalability, leading to poor detection accuracy in traditional models. Access the full paper here > https://buff.ly/4hOps7Z

#UniversityofSaskatchewan #SouthChinaNormalUniversity #AttentionMechanism #DrugDetection
